item.title: Erica add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Erica add a quote by Breyten Breytenbach
item.description: "Even ivory towers need central heating." -- Breyten Breytenbach

item.title: Erica add a quote by John Hepworth
item.description: "God, there must be a meaning. Fiercely he was certain that there must be a meaning. Surely, while we live we are not lost. Oh Janos, Janos my brother! Surely we are not lost--while we live." -- John Hepworth

item.title: Erica add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
item.description: "I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem." -- Diana Gabaldon

item.title: Erica add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "A good newspaper, I suppose, is a nation talking to itself." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Erica add a quote by Matt Groening
item.description: "I know all those words, but that sentence makes no sense to me." -- Matt Groening

item.title: Erica add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "I've committed to nothing...and that's just suicide...by tiny, tiny increments." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Erica add a quote by Gary Larson
item.description: "Welcome to Hell. Here's your accordion." -- Gary Larson

item.title: Erica add a quote by Roger Hedden
item.description: "When you don't know where you're going, you drive on the highway." -- Roger Hedden

item.title: Erica add a quote by John Welter
item.description: "I was trying to have an insight, and all I could think of was that I'd backed myself into a corner, and the corner was me." -- John Welter

item.title: Erica add a quote by George Macaulay Trevelyan
item.description: "Education...has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading." -- George Macaulay Trevelyan

item.title: Erica add a quote by Larry Niven
item.description: "The gods do not protect fools. Fools are protected by more capable fools." -- Larry Niven

item.title: Erica add a quote by Spider Robinson
item.description: "Sometimes I think I must have a Guardian Idiot. A little invisible spirit just behind my shoulder, looking out for me...only he's an imbecile." -- Spider Robinson

item.title: Erica add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "I live not in myself, but I become Portion of that around me: and to me High mountains are a feeling, but the hum of human cities torture." -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Erica add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "..the happy hum of humanity." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Erica add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "So long as governments set the example of killing their enemies, private individuals will occasionally kill theirs." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Erica add a quote by Louis D. Brandeis
item.description:
"Experience should teach us to be most on our guard to protect liberty when the government's purposes are beneficent. Men born to freedom are naturally alert to repel invasion of their liberty by evil-minded rulers. The greatest dangers to liberty lurk in insidious encroachment by men of zeal, well-meaning but without understanding."
[<i>Olmstead v. U.S.</i>, 277 U.S. 438 (1928) (dissenting)]" -- Louis D. Brandeis

item.title: Erica add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "I can't go on, I'll go on." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Erica add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Erica add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Erica add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Nor shall this peace sleep with her; but as when The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix, Her ashes new-create another heir As great in admiration as herself." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Erica add a quote by Virgil
item.description: "Vera incessu patuit dea. (The goddess indubitable was revealed in her step.)" -- Virgil

item.title: Erica add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Well,' the Goddess said, 'your heart didn't heal straight the last time it broke. So we'll break it again and reset it so it heals straight this time." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Erica add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "At Tara in this fateful hour, I place all Heaven with its power, And the sun with its brightness, And the snow with its whiteness, And the fire with all the strength it hath, And the lightning with its rapid wrath, And the winds with their swiftness along their path, And the sea with its deepness, And the rocks with their steepness, And the earth with its starkness: All these I place, By God's almighty help and grace Between myself and the powers of darkness!" -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Erica add a quote by Percy Bysshe Shelley
item.description:
"<b>Ozymandias</b>
I met a traveller from an antique land Who said: "Two vast and trunkless legs of stone Stand in the desert. Near them on the sand, Half sunk, a shattered visage lies, whose frown And wrinkled lip and sneer of cold command Tell that its sculptor well those passions read Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things, The hand that mocked them and the heart that fed. And on the pedestal these words appear: 'My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings: Look on my works, ye mighty, and despair!' Nothing beside remains. Round the decay Of that colossal wreck, boundless and bare, The lone and level sands stretch far away." -- Percy Bysshe Shelley

item.title: Erica add a quote by John Champlin Gardner
item.description: "They watch on, evil, incredibly stupid, enjoying my destruction.<br><br>'Poor Grendel's had an accident,' I whisper. 'So may you all." -- John Champlin Gardner

item.title: Erica add a quote by Mary Doria Russell
item.description: "The Jewish sages also tell us that God dances when His children defeat Him in argument, when they stand on their feet and use their minds. So questions like Anne's are worth asking. To ask them is a very fine kind of human behavior. If we keep demanding that God yield up His answers, perhaps some day we will understand them. And then we will be something more than clever apes, and we shall dance with God." -- Mary Doria Russell

item.title: Erica add a quote by John Dunning
item.description: "The world was getting dangerously crowded with crazy people." -- John Dunning

item.title: Erica add a quote by Sergei Lukyanenko
item.description: "The common good and the individual good rarely coincide." -- Sergei Lukyanenko

item.title: Erica add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert
